uk.co.skyem.projects.Z80emu.util.buffer

Interface IByteBuffer

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    IBusDevice
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractByteBuffer, Bus, BusOffset, BusWindow, ByteBuffer, Memory, Program, SimpleBusDevice, SimpleIO

    public interface IByteBuffer

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      byte getByte(int position)
      Gets a byte from the buffer.
      byte[] getBytes(int position, int amount)
      Gets a number of bytes from the buffer.
      int getDWord(int position)
      Gets a dword (two words, or four bytes) from the buffer.
      long getQWord(int position)
      Gets a qword (two dwords, or four words, or eight bytes) from the buffer.
      short getWord(int position)
      Gets a word (two bytes) from the buffer.
      void putByte(int position, byte data)
      Gives the buffer a byte.
      void putBytes(int position, byte[] data)
      Gives a number of bytes to the buffer.
      void putDWord(int position, int data)
      Gives the buffer a dword (two words, or four bytes).
      void putQWord(int position, long data)
      Gives the buffer a qword (two dwords, or four words, or eight bytes).
      void putWord(int position, short data)
      Gives the buffer a word (two bytes).

    • Method Detail

      • putByte

        void putByte(int position,
             byte data)
        Gives the buffer a byte.
        Parameters:
        position - The 'address' of the data
        data - The data being given to the device

      • getByte

        byte getByte(int position)
        Gets a byte from the buffer.
        Parameters:
        position - The 'address' of the data
        Returns:
        The data from the device

      • getBytes

        byte[] getBytes(int position,
                int amount)
        Gets a number of bytes from the buffer.
        Parameters:
        position - The start 'address' of the data
        amount - The number of bytes to get
        Returns:
        a byte array with the data from the buffer

      • putBytes

        void putBytes(int position,
              byte[] data)
        Gives a number of bytes to the buffer.
        Parameters:
        position - The start 'address' of the data
        data - a byte array with the data to give to the buffer
